titles.title: Federal Election Integrity Act of 2007
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit certain State election administration officials from actively participating in electoral campaigns.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E3)

bill.summary:
1/4/2007--Introduced.
Federal Election Integrity Act of 2007 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to make it unlawful for a chief state election administration official to take active part in political management or in a political campaign with respect to any election for federal office over which the official has supervisory authority.
